word: "Provide neither gold nor silver, nor brass in your purses, nor scrip for your journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet staves; for the workman is worthy of his meat. And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, inquire who in it is worthy, and there abide till ye go thence. . . Behold I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves, be ye therefore wise as serpents and harmless as doves."
